BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger. As a consequence of new snow and wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent towards the evening.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
During the night soft wind slabs formed especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. As a consequence of new snow and strong wind they will increase in size as the day progresses. These can sometimes be released by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size, especially on wind-loaded slopes. Such avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

As a consequence of new snow and wind more frequent dry avalanches are possible by the evening, even large ones in isolated cases.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some regions 30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall.
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow significantly. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
As a consequence of falling temperatures and snowfall and the occasionally strong wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form. The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a resilient melt-freeze crust.
Above approximately 2100 m a lot of snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger. As a consequence of new snow and wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent towards the evening.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
During the night soft wind slabs formed especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. As a consequence of new snow and strong wind they will increase in size as the day progresses. These can sometimes be released by a single winter sport participant and reach medium size, especially on wind-loaded slopes. Such avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

As a consequence of new snow and wind dry avalanches are possible by the evening, even medium-sized ones.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some regions up to 20 cm of snow, and up to 40 cm in some localities, will fall.
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow significantly. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
As a consequence of falling temperatures and snowfall and the occasionally strong wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form. The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a resilient melt-freeze crust.
Above approximately 2100 m a lot of snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the snowfall.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Down to 1000 m and below snow will fall until the evening in some regions. The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. The fresh wind slabs can in some places be released by small loads, but they will be small in most cases.
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some localities 10 to 30 cm of snow, but less in some localities, will fall until the evening above approximately 2000 m.

The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong melt-freeze crust.
In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow. As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase on Monday.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The sometimes deep wind slabs of the last few days can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 2500 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. As a consequence of falling temperatures the snowpack will consolidate.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist and its surface has a strong crust. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. In particular adjacent to ridgelines as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent and larger. Adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and on wind-loaded slopes medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible. In particular on steep sunny slopes loose snow avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can be released by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Weak layers exist in the top section of the snowpack. The wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack. They must be evaluated with care and prudence.
In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area light precipitation.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in particular on west to north to east facing aspects above approximately 2200 m. In high Alpine regions the avalanche prone locations are present in all aspects and the danger is slightly greater. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Avalanches can reach medium size in isolated cases, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation in particular at elevated altitudes and.

More frequent mostly small loose snow avalanches are to be expected, especially in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: In particular in the south up to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. Up to 20 cm of snow, and up to 25 cm in some localities, will fall. In the north 10 to 15 cm of snow will fall. The wind will be moderate. The more recent wind slabs will be deposited on soft layers at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some regions up to 20 cm of snow will fall. Fresh wind slabs require caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the snowfall. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
The fresh wind slabs can in isolated cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. This applies in particular on very steep slopes.

As a consequence of new snow and wind natural dry avalanches are possible, but they can reach medium size in isolated cases, especially on extremely steep slopes and at intermediate and high altitudes, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some localities 10 to 30 cm of snow will fall until the evening above approximately 2000 m.
The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong melt-freeze crust.
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow. As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase on Monday.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The snowpack remains prone to triggering in some places. Some small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized avalanches are further possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Along the border with France, along the border with Switzerland and in high Alpine regions the avalanche danger is one level higher. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the last few days sometimes deep wind slabs formed in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain as well as at high altitude. As a consequence of new snow and wind they will increase in size additionally as the day progresses. These can be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep slopes.
(--), caution is to be exercised in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland.

In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation loose snow avalanches are possible, but they can reach medium size in isolated cases, in particular on extremely steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some localities 20 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Tuesday, in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland.
Monday: In some localities 5 to 20 cm of snow, but less in some localities, will fall until the evening above approximately 2000 m.
As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase on Monday.
The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface consists of loosely bonded snow lying on a strong melt-freeze crust.
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The snowpack remains prone to triggering in some places. Some small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized avalanches are further possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind and new snow to above approximately 800 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The fresh and older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in particular on steep shady slopes above the tree line. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are mostly small. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. At elevated altitudes the avalanche prone locations are more widespread. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Up to 30 cm of snow will fall above approximately 800 m. As a consequence of low temperatures and snowfall and the moderate wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some regions up to 15 cm of snow will fall. Wind slabs require caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The somewhat older wind slabs are in individual cases still prone to triggering.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The somewhat older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases in particular on west to north to east facing aspects above approximately 2200 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. At elevated altitudes the avalanche prone locations are more widespread. Avalanches can in very isolated cases reach medium size, in particular at elevated altitudes.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are possible. This applies on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow will fall.
In many cases new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust, in particular on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. Wind slabs are lying on soft layers at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some regions up to 15 cm of snow will fall. Fresh wind slabs require caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The more recent wind slabs are mostly small and can only be released in isolated cases, especially adjacent to ridgelines at elevated altitudes. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some localities up to 10 cm of snow has fallen. Some snow will fall in the south. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.
In particular below the tree line only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some regions up to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall. Fresh wind slabs require caution.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Some fresh snow as well as the mostly small wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of the snowfall individual dry and moist avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: These weather conditions will facilitate a rise in the danger of dry and moist avalanches in particular on wind-loaded slopes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of sharply falling temperatures the snowpack will consolidate during the next few days. Some fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on north to northeast to northwest facing aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Wet avalanches are unlikely to occcur.
